t: To the choirmaster: according to The Gittith. A Psalm of David.
O*pn Lord,*s our Lord, how*ld majestic is your name in all the earth! You*ln have set your glory above the heavens.
Out*ld of the mouth of babies and infants, you*ln have established strength because of your foes, to*ld still the enemy and the avenger.
When*pn I look at your heavens, the work of your fingers, the*ld moon and the stars, which you have set in place,
what*ln is man that you are mindful of him, and*ld the son of man that you care for him?
Yet*pn you have made him a little lower than the heavenly beings and*ld crowned him with glory and honor.
You*ln have given him dominion over the works of your hands; you*ld have put all things under his feet,
all*ln sheep and oxen, and*ld also the beasts of the field,
the*ln birds of the heavens, and the fish of the sea, whatever*ld passes along the paths of the seas.
O*pn Lord,*s our Lord, how*ld majestic is your name in all the earth!
